clustering_scheme.rationale: Clusters group the contributor pipeline, social learning dynamics, and knowledge management, with a separate attraction/retention module. This respects Wenger’s participation-to-core progression and Nonaka’s tacit–explicit knowledge spiral while minimizing cross-cluster links.

clusters.name: Contributor Pipeline
clusters.theme: Progression from newcomer to experienced to core developers and associated throughput flows.

clusters.name: Community Dynamics
clusters.theme: Social learning, mentoring, participation intensity, and belonging that drive legitimate peripheral participation.

clusters.name: Knowledge Management (SECI)
clusters.theme: Creation, maintenance, and use of explicit knowledge and shared context supporting the SECI spiral.

clusters.name: Attraction & Retention
clusters.theme: Conversion of potential contributors into newcomers and attrition control across early stages.

layout_hints: Place Contributor Pipeline centrally; it has the highest cross-cluster degree.
Position Knowledge Management (SECI) to the left of Pipeline and Community Dynamics to the right to shorten mentoring and documentation links.
Place Attraction & Retention above Pipeline, aligned near New Contributors to minimize crossings for onboarding/dropout flows.
Keep Ba (Shared Context) and Project Explicit Knowledge near the left edge of the Knowledge cluster to reduce line length to Skill up and Mentorship.

theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: The current model already includes movement from periphery to core and mentoring, but lacks mechanisms for legitimate peripheral participation and social belonging that shape retention and learning throughput. Adding ‘Good First Issues’, participation intensity, belonging, and mentoring capacity operationalizes community access and engagement, improving both progression and early-stage retention. These changes create clear reinforcing/balancing feedbacks (e.g., mentoring capacity dilution with many newcomers) consistent with Wenger’s framework.

variables.name: Good First Issues Available
variables.description: Availability of low-barrier tasks that allow legitimate peripheral participation by newcomers.

variables.name: Newcomer Participation Intensity
variables.description: Average effort and frequency with which newcomers engage in practice, shaped by task access and mentoring.

variables.name: Sense of Belonging
variables.description: Perceived inclusion and identification with the community; reduces dropout and attrition.

variables.name: New Contributor Dropout Rate
variables.description: Rate at which newcomers disengage from the project.

variables.name: Experienced Contributor Attrition Rate
variables.description: Rate at which experienced contributors leave the project.

variables.name: Core Developer Mentoring Capacity
variables.description: Effective capacity of core developers to provide mentoring given available time and newcomer load.
Renamed to represent the external pool of people who could potentially join the project.

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: The model includes mentoring (socialization) and documentation (explicit transfer) but lacks explicit representation of the explicit knowledge stock, its creation/decay, and shared context (Ba). Adding these elements and the time-allocation tradeoff between mentoring and externalization makes the SECI spiral operational, improves the realism of learning and onboarding pathways, and supports policy analysis (e.g., investing in Ba or documentation).

variables.name: Project Explicit Knowledge
variables.description: Accumulated documentation, contributor guides, and structured artifacts available to the community.

variables.name: Documentation Creation Rate
variables.description: Rate at which tacit knowledge is externalized/combined into new or improved documentation.

variables.name: Documentation Decay Rate
variables.description: Rate at which existing documentation becomes obsolete or inaccurate.

variables.name: Ba (Shared Context)
variables.description: Quality of shared spaces/processes (tools, meetings, forums) that enable socialization and externalization.

variables.name: Externalization Effort Allocation
variables.description: Share of contributor time/attention allocated to documentation and explicit knowledge work.

variables.name: New Contributor Onboarding Rate
variables.description: Rate at which potential contributors complete onboarding to become New Contributors.
Renamed to clarify scope and level (turnover specific to Core Developer stock).
Renamed to emphasize it is an effectiveness/intensity multiplier derived from the explicit knowledge stock and accessibility.
